articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Greets PM of Burkina Faso
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Greets PM of Burkina Faso
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Paul Kaba Thieba upon his appointment as prime minister of Burkina Faso. 
					 The message expressed belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries will grow stronger and wished him success in his responsible work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong Greets Guinean FM
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong Greets Guinean FM
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, foreign minister of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Makale Camara upon her appointment as minister of Foreign Affairs and Overseas Compatriots of Guinea. 
					 The message expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries will grow stronger and wished her success in her new job.

articles.title: DPRK Representative at Geneva Sends Letter to Member of Managing Board of World Economic Forum
articles.content:
DPRK Representative at Geneva Sends Letter to Member of Managing Board of World Economic Forum 
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- The permanent representative of the DPRK to the UN Office and other international organizations in Geneva sent a letter to the member of the Managing Board of the World Economic Forum on Jan. 14.
					 The letter expressed deep concern over the fact that the participation of a DPRK's delegation in the Davos World Economic Forum that had already been on schedule was cancelled due to a sudden and irresponsible move taken by the Forum.
					
					 The delegation decided to take part in the Forum meeting, taking into consideration the repeated requests by the Forum and hoped to avail itself of the opportunity to introduce the economic performance in the DPRK and promote economic cooperation with several countries on the principles of friendship and mutual reciprocity, the letter said. However, the Forum, unbecoming for its character and appearance as an international body for discussing economic issues, unilaterally cancelled the DPRK delegation's participation by citing an unjustifiable political reason, the letter added.
					
					 It noted that the behavior of the Forum is a very sinister act of defying the elementary impartiality and principles to be abided by the international body as it took advantage of the moves of some forces pursuing extreme hostile policy toward the DPRK. 
					
					 The letter emphasized that the Forum will be held duly responsible for the consequences to be entailed by its unfriendly measure taken against the DPRK, a dignified sovereign state and full-fledged economic entity in Northeast Asia.

articles.title: Senior Officials Visit Lodging Quarters of Representatives of Events for Celebrating Youth League Anniversary
articles.content:
Senior Officials Visit Lodging Quarters of Representatives of Events for Celebrating Youth League Anniversary
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- Senior party and state officials Thursday visited lodging quarters of the representatives of the events for celebrating the 70th founding anniversary of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League. 
					 Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop and other officials of the party and armed forces bodies and the Cabinet met the representatives of the events. 
					
					 They warmly congratulated the officials of the youth league and young people honored to attend the events under the care of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Hearing stories of young people who performed the new legendary tales about youth and feats in defending the country and building a thriving nation, they encouraged the representatives. 
					
					 Saying that heroic feats of the young people have been recorded in the monumental structures and successes made in the drive for building an economic power, they requested the representatives to steadily exalt the honor of creating the charging spirit and culture of young people in the Songun era, bearing deep in mind the trust reposed by the party in projecting them as the master of the youth power.

articles.title: Contributors to H-bomb Test Stay in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Contributors to H-bomb Test Stay in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- Nuclear scientists, technicians, soldier-builders, workers and officials who contributed to the successful test of the first H-bomb of Juche Korea spent their pleasant days in Pyongyang from Jan. 8 to 13.
					 They visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun where President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il lie in state, with the news of the great success in the H-bomb test.
					
					 A ceremony of awarding party and state commendations to nuclear scientists, technicians, soldier-builders, workers and officials who contributed to the first successful H-bomb test took place with splendor in the presence of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They visited the Phyongchon Revolutionary Site and the Sci-Tech Complex.
					
					 They toured the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace and enjoyed themselves at the Munsu Water Park and the Combined Service Boat Mujigae.
					
					 They expressed deep thanks to Kim Jong Un for arranging a banquet and birthday spreads and giving gifts to them.
					
					 They came back on Jan. 13.

articles.title: Homage Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Homage Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- The participants of the events for celebrating the 70th anniversary of founding of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Thursday.
					 The visitors paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues at the palace.
					
					 In the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state they made deep bows to them.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders the great leaders received are on display and the halls which house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Commanding Officers of KPISF Start Study Tour of Revolutionary Battle Sites in Area of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Commanding Officers of KPISF Start Study Tour of Revolutionary Battle Sites in Area of Mt. Paektu
 Hyesan, January 14 (KCNA) -- Commanding officers of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces (KPISF) started a study tour of the revolutionary battle sites in the area of Mt. Paektu.
					 A kick-off ceremony was held before the Monument to the Victorious Battle of Pochonbo in Hyesan, Ryanggang Province on Thursday.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket before the statue of President Kim Il Sung at the monument.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the participants started the march toward Pochonbo, a historical site, flying flags of the supreme commander and the study tour group.

articles.title: More Joint Army-Civilian Meetings Hail Successful H-bomb Test
articles.content:
More Joint Army-Civilian Meetings Hail Successful H-bomb Test
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- Joint army-civilian meetings took place in Munchon, Kaesong, Sinpho and Huichon cities and Paechon, Phyongwon, Popdong and other counties to hail the successful first H-bomb test of Juche Korea. 
					 They were attended by officials of the local party and power bodies, working people's organizations, factories, enterprisers, farms and universities, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, working people, youths and students. 
					
					 The statement of the DPRK government was read out and congratulatory speeches were made.
					
					 Speakers said that through the successful H-bomb test the DPRK appeared in the center of the world as a power with the strongest nuclear deterrent. 
					
					 They said that the service personnel and people of the DPRK will take hold on the nuclear treasured sword and step up the building of an economic giant while mercilessly shattering the evermore escalating nuclear blackmail by the U.S. imperialists. 
					
					 They called upon all the people to bring about a big leap forward and great innovations in the production and construction full of conviction of sure victory and optimism under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea and thus make positive contributions to glorifying the Seventh Congress of the WPK as one of victors and glory.

articles.title: New Stamp Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stamp Issued in DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK State Stamp Bureau issued a sheet featuring the ideas carried in supreme leader Kim Jong Un's New Year address.
					 Seen in the upper part of the stamp are "Let us usher in a golden age in building a thriving nation this year when the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea is to be held!", a slogan advanced in the New Year address, and letters reading "7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea".
					
					 In his New Year address the supreme leader stressed that leading sectors of the nation's economy should make a breakthrough in building an economic giant. He also called for strengthening the politico-military might of the DPRK in every way, adhering to the principle of giving priority to self-development in building a thriving nation and ensuring that the people enjoy the highest quality of civilization on the highest level.

articles.title: Ice Sculptures Displayed on Bank of Taedong River
articles.content:
Ice Sculptures Displayed on Bank of Taedong River
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- Ice sculptures, created by the Art Studio of the Korean People's Army, are displayed on the bank of the Taedong River in front of Kim Il Sung Square here.
					 The sculptures lively represent the steadfast will of the army and the people of the DPRK to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche, started in Mt. Paektu, under the guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They include sculpture "Party Flag", which pictures the flag of the Workers' Party of Korea fluttering on Mt. Paektu with the letters "7th Congress of the Party" carved in its lower part, and sculpture "Bugler Sounding Advance" calling for strengthening the armed forces of the DPRK into an invincible army reliably inheriting the traditions of anti-Japanese revolution.
					
					 There are also ice sculptures featuring Mirae Scientists Street, Paektusan Hero Youth Power Station and other edifices and fishing boat Tanphung.

articles.title: Korean Jurists Committee Accuses U.S. of Sidestepping Conclusion of Peace Treaty with DPRK
articles.content:
Korean Jurists Committee Accuses U.S. of Sidestepping Conclusion of Peace Treaty with DPRK 
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- The Korean Jurists Committee released a white paper on January 14, disclosing the U.S. criminal acts of persistently sidestepping the conclusion of a peace treaty with the DPRK, an international legal guarantee for defending peace and security in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world, and laying bare the U.S. sinister aim lurking behind it before the international community and the world progressives.
					 A peace treaty is an international one which should be concluded in order to put a definite end to the state of war from a legal point of view and establish the relations of lasting peace, the white paper noted, and went on:
					
					 How to approach the peace treaty is a touchstone to distinguish the peace-loving forces and trigger-happy forces.
					
					 The Korean Armistice Agreement (AA) was adopted as an international legal document which envisaged the independent and peaceful settlement of the Korean issue free from any foreign interference and the establishment of the lasting peace-keeping mechanism in the Korean Peninsula, not a temporary halt to belligerence, thanks to the DPRK's positive and stubborn struggle to lay a legal groundwork for setting up the relations of peace after the war. 
					
					 The core provision of the AA is Paragraph 60 because it stipulates the withdrawal of all foreign troops from Korea and the peaceful and fundamental settlement of the Korean issue by the concerted efforts of the Koreans and this serves as a clear legal ground for concluding a peace treaty in the future.
					
					 The U.S. has desperately blocked the peaceful settlement of the Korean issue, systematically violating the AA since the very day of its conclusion. 
					
					 It breached the core provisions of the AA calling for the establishment of the peace-keeping mechanism in the Korean Peninsula right after the ceasefire.
					
					 The U.S. unilaterally scrapped Paragraph 13 d of the AA banning the introduction of all war hardware into Korea from abroad in 1957 and shipped into the Korean Peninsula various type war means and destructive weapons including nuclear weapons.
					
					 It reinforced aggressor forces in systematic violation of Paragraph 13 c of the AA banning the reinforcement of military personnel.
					
					 In 1991 the U.S. nominated a general of the south Korean army as senior member of "UN Forces" of the Military Armistice Commission though it is neither party to the AA nor he is justified to hold the post, completely paralyzing the armistice mechanism.
					
					 The U.S. has frantically perpetrated military provocations and saber-rattling free from any legal and institutional binding.
					
					 The Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army in a statement of its spokesman on March 5, 2013 finally declared the complete nullification of the AA due to the U.S. as a counteraction for self-defense in order to cope with the U.S. evermore undisguised violations of the AA and its ever-escalating hostile policy toward the DPRK. 
					
					 As the AA was nullified due to the persistent violations of the AA by the U.S. and the inevitable measures taken by the DPRK for self-defence, the relations between the DPRK and the U.S. turned into de facto belligerent ones from the mere technical state of war.
					
					 The situation reached the brink of war in a moment in August, 2015 due to a trifling incident caused for unknown reason. 
					
					 This finally proved that the defunct AA can hardly preserve peace in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The DPRK recently proposed once again concluding a peace treaty for ensuring lasting peace in the Korean Peninsula at the 70th session of the UN General Assembly and on various other occasions, as required by the dramatically changed recent situation in the peninsula.
					
					 The conclusion of a peace treaty is an urgent requirement for ensuring peace and security not only in the Korean Peninsula but in the region and the rest of the world.
					
					 Peace-keeping mechanism has not yet been built in Northeast Asia though it is a very sensitive region beset with a lot of social, historical, political and military problems. 
					
					 The U.S. has escalated the tension in the peninsula, attaching importance to it. This is, in the final analysis, prompted by its ulterior design to contain and pressurize the big powers around the peninsula and put them under its control and thus carry out more easily its strategy for dominating the world.
					
					 The conclusion of a peace treaty presents itself as an urgent matter and a top priority task to be tackled without delay in the light of the present situation in the peninsula where a war may break out any moment and the interests of regional countries which lack peace-keeping mechanism.
					
					 The U.S. is sidestepping the conclusion of a peace treaty with the DPRK, claiming that it is a wrong order for the DPRK to call for the conclusion of a peace treaty and there should be crucial progress in the denuclearization, to begin with.
					
					 The issue of the conclusion of a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S. is nothing new and it was not spawned by the former's nuclear deterrent. The DPRK has called for its conclusion long before its access to nuclear deterrent.
					
					 The U.S. demand that the DPRK dismantle its nuclear weapons as a precondition for the conclusion of a peace treaty is an illegal and brigandish assertion diametrically running counter to norms of international law governing the exercise of the right to self-defence.
					
					 The DPRK's access to nuclear weapons is entirely legitimate in view of the requirements of international law as it is a measure taken by it for self-defence to protect its supreme interests from the escalating nuclear threat and danger of war posed by the U.S. 
					
					 The U.S. is persistently shunning the conclusion of a peace treaty with the DPRK in a bid to occupy it by mounting a surprise military attack while keeping the unstable situation in the peninsula and threatening the DPRK by force. 
					
					 For this purpose the U.S. has introduced huge aggressor forces and nuclear war means into south Korea to increase the nuclear threat to the DPRK, refusing to honestly respond to its fair proposal for concluding a peace treaty and systematically violating the AA.
					
					 All facts go to patently prove that the U.S. desperate moves to stifle the DPRK by force, dead-set against the conclusion of a peace treaty with the latter, are extremely dangerous crimes against the regulations of the international law calling for refraining from threatening other countries' sovereignty by force and banning aggression and war and crimes contrary to commitments under the bilateral treaty it promised to fulfill and illegal actions against the international practice calling for establishing relations of peace. 
					
					 The U.S. opposition to the conclusion of the peace treaty with the DPRK is pursuant to its hostile policy toward the DPRK aimed to effect regime change and bring down its social system.
					
					 No matter how vociferously the U.S. may advocate "peace" in the Korean Peninsula, it can never put under carpet the aggressive nature of the hostile policy it has pursued against the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK will neither dismantle its nuclear weapons nor stop its nuclear development but further bolster its all type nuclear weapons including H-bomb both in quality and quantity unless the U.S. rolls back its harsh hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. should admit the criminal nature of its opposition to the proposal for concluding a peace treaty with the DPRK, own due responsibility under international law before the DPRK and the international community and respond to the proposal for establishing the peace-keeping mechanism in the peninsula without delay.

articles.title: DPRK's Access to H-bomb Aimed to Finally Settle Accounts with Aggressors: Minju Joson
articles.content:
DPRK's Access to H-bomb Aimed to Finally Settle Accounts with Aggressors: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- Upon hearing the news that Juche Korea completely succeeded in the first H-bomb test, the south Korean chief executive rushed to her underground shelter, going busy with holding a "security meeting" and crying out for forcing the north to "pay a very high price for it".
					 Echoing her outbursts, Chongwadae issued a "statement" and issued an order for "state of emergency". In the meantime, gentries of the "Saenuri Party" cried out for "nuclear weaponization," blustering that they would not allow the DPRK's access to nukes".
					
					 Minju Joson Thursday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The south Korean conservative ruling forces' hysteric row of pulling up the DPRK only touches off derision among all Koreans.
					
					 The DPRK's H-bomb test allows no one to slander it as it is the just self-defensive measure of a sovereign state.
					
					 It is self-evident that one can not cope with the ever-increasing nuclear threat and blackmail of the U.S. and its followers with their bare hands.
					
					 This truth has been proved in practice in the whole historic course of the confrontation with the U.S. over the past several decades.
					
					 This being a hard reality, the south Korean conservative group is vociferating about what it called "price" in a bid to downplay the significance of the event to be specially recorded in the nation's history spanning five thousand years. This is nothing but a revelation of bitter hatred hostility towards the compatriots in the north.
					
					 Gone are days never to return when the DPRK could talk to the group.
					
					 As the army and people of the DPRK paid a very high price owing to the U.S. moves, they are waiting for the moment to finally settle accounts with the U.S. The DPRK had access to H-bomb despite manifold difficulties and hardships not to hurt the compatriots under any circumstances. It is aimed to finally settle accounts with the aggressors and provocateurs keen to do harm to the DPRK and thus ultimately defuse the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula and bring an eternal rosy future to the nation.

articles.title: Worsening Joblessness of Young People in S. Korea
articles.content:
Worsening Joblessness of Young People in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- The joblessness of young people is becoming a serious matter in south Korea. 
					 According to the "situation of employment in December, 2015 and whole year" announced by the Statistics Agency of south Korea on January 13, the rate of joblessness of young people last year was higher than that in the previous year, recording an all time high since the statistics standard changed in 1999. 
					
					 The south Korean Yonhap News said although the young people of south Korea desperately knocked the door of employment market, the rate of joblessness of young people has been on the increase because the opportunity of job seeking has not widened.

articles.title: S. Korean People Protest against Humiliating Act of Regime
articles.content:
S. Korean People Protest against Humiliating Act of Regime 
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities covered up the hideous unethical crimes of Japan through their pro-Japanese humiliating act, touching off strong protest among people from all walks of life. 
					 According to the results of opinion poll conducted by the south Korean paper Kukmin Ilbo on January 8, a majority of respondents said no to the "agreement" between south Korea and Japan over the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army. 
					
					 A negative opinion prevailed within the ruling and opposition parties.
					
					 The respondents denounced shameless Japan and the humiliating attitude of the south Korean authorities.

articles.title: DPRK's First H-bomb Test Hailed by Koreans in China
articles.content:
DPRK's First H-bomb Test Hailed by Koreans in China
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- There took place a meeting in Yanji City, China on Jan. 10 for hailing the DPRK's successful first H-bomb test.
					 Present at the meeting were representatives of the Yanbian Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China and affiliated branches and members of the Yanbian Regional Association of the Federation of Korean Young Nationals in China.
					
					 They heard the DPRK's government statement at the meeting.
					
					 Speakers said that Juche Korea's successful first H-bomb test under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un was a great event to be specially recorded in the national history spanning 5 000 years.
					
					 The first H-bomb test is not only a striking demonstration of the tremendous national power of the country but also a just measure for self-defense taken to firmly protect the sovereignty of the country and the vital rights of the nation from the daily growing nuclear threat and blackmail by the U.S.-led hostile forces and reliably guarantee peace in the Korean Peninsula and regional security.
					
					 They said that the Koreans in China would turn out more vigorously in the patriotic undertaking for the prosperity and independent reunification of the country under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Indonesian Political Party Extends Solidarity to Korean People's Cause
articles.content:
Indonesian Political Party Extends Solidarity to Korean People's Cause 
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- The National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia on January 9 made public a statement in support of the proposals for reunification of Korea set forth by supreme leader Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address and the successful first H-bomb test of the DPRK. 
					 The statement said:
					
					 The National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia fully supports the proposals for reunification clarified by H.E. Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address. 
					
					 It also fully supports the DPRK's successful H-bomb test. 
					
					 The proposal for rejecting foreign intervention and resolving the issue of Korea's reunification independently on the principle of By Korean Nation Itself and preserving peace and security on the Korean Peninsula is the most justifiable and realistic one. 
					
					 The DPRK's successful H-bomb test to cope with the ever-more escalating moves of the U.S. and its followers to stifle the DPRK is the exercise of its right to self-defense and demonstration of its strong military muscle. 
					
					 We fully support the DPRK's self-defensive measure and extend firm solidarity to the just cause of the Korean people for protecting sovereignty and right to existence of the country and nation and achieving the independent reunification of Korea.

articles.title: Italian Body Hails DPRK's Successful H- Bomb Test
articles.content:
Italian Body Hails DPRK's Successful H- Bomb Test 
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- The Communist Youth Front of Italy on January 7 made public a statement in support of the DPRK's success in its legitimate H- bomb test. 
					 The statement denounced foreign forces' desperate criticism of the DPRK these days and expressed solidarity for it. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 We share the stand of all anti-imperialist organizations which have consistently called for denuclearization under equal conditions. 
					
					 Denuclearization is possible only through multilateral negotiations conducted under equal conditions. 
					
					 The international law allowing a specified state's access to nuclear weapons is unacceptable. 
					
					 The UN should not slap sanctions on a country, infringing its sovereignty, and force it to unilaterally dismantle its nuclear weapons. 
					
					 The DPRK has never imposed a war on any country. 
					
					 However, the U.S. ignited wars of aggression and is busy staging military drills in different parts of the world. 
					
					 All the forces crying out for sanctions against the DPRK are nuclear weapons states and they have so far conducted many nuclear tests. 
					
					 It is worth recalling that the DPRK declared it would never use nuclear weapons unless its sovereignty is violated.

articles.title: DPRK's H-bomb Test Hailed in Bangladesh
articles.content:
DPRK's H-bomb Test Hailed in Bangladesh 
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- There took place a solidarity meeting at the building of the Bangladesh People's League on January 7 under the co-sponsorship of the People's League and the Bangladesh Self-Reliance Research Centre hailing the DPRK's successful first H-bomb test and supporting the Korean people's just cause. 
					 The meeting heard a statement of the DPRK government on the successful first H-bomb test of Juche Korea and adopted a solidarity statement. 
					
					 The statement congratulated the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government and people on the successful H-bomb test which provided the ever-lasting guarantee for defending the sovereignty and dignity of the country and nation and opened up rosy prospect for building a thriving nation. 
					
					 The statement expressed belief that the WPK and the government and people of the DPRK would protect the sovereignty and dignity of the country and nation and peace and security of the region and surely build a thriving nation by dint of the powerful nuclear deterrent.

articles.title: DPRK's First Successful H-bomb Test Supported by Bulgarian, Nepalese Organizations
articles.content:
DPRK's First Successful H-bomb Test Supported by Bulgarian, Nepalese Organizations
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Bulgaria and Nepal made public statements in support of the DPRK's first successful H-bomb test.
					 The Bulgarian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on Jan. 7 extended full support and warm congratulations to the DPRK which proved successful in its first H-bomb test.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The DPRK's successful H-bomb test means a fresh and shining victory of the independent idea and cause of peace on the Korean Peninsula and a heavy blow at the U.S. imperialists and their followers.
					
					 The recent test is supported and hailed by all those aspiring after peace and security in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world as it is in full accord with the inviolable right of all people to defend their country.
					
					 We are convinced that the DPRK led by Marshal Kim Jong Un will steadily develop its nuclear deterrent and thus reliably safeguard peace and security in the peninsula and the rest of the world.
					
					 The Nepal Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics said on Jan. 9:
					
					 The Nepalese people and other peace-loving progressive people of the world are pleased with the DPRK's successful H-bomb test.
					
					 The recent test is a self-defensive measure for safeguarding the right of the Korean nation from the imperialist big powers' nuclear threat and blackmail.
					
					 The DPRK's test proving a higher stage of developing its nuclear force will go down in history as it is a distinguished contribution to world peace.

articles.title: DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test Supported by British Organizations
articles.content:
DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test Supported by British Organizations
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- A video conference of the British progressive political party and social organizations took place on January 9 to hail the DPRK's successful H-bomb test.
					 Present there were figures of political parties and organizations including the New Communist Party of Britain, the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Korean Friendship Association UK and masses.
					
					 The statement of the DPRK government on the success in the first H-bomb test was read out and congratulatory speeches were made.
					
					 Speakers said that the DPRK's successful H-bomb test conducted in the run-up to the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea provide a sure guarantee for the future of the Korean revolution and world socialism.
					
					 The DPRK succeeded even in its H-bomb test in the wake of completion of lots of structures startling the world such as Mirae Scientists Street and the Sci-Tech Complex, they noted, adding:
					
					 This meant a historic event which declared the total failure and fiasco of the U.S. imperialists' hostile policy towards the DPRK and a great victory of the Juche idea and Songun idea.
					
					 The conference underscored the need to build up strong public opinion proving the justice of the DPRK's access to nuclear deterrent and measures to bolster it and condemning the U.S. moves to stifle it.

articles.title: Politician of DR Congo Hails DPRK's Success in H-bomb Test
articles.content:
Politician of DR Congo Hails DPRK's Success in H-bomb Test
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK ranked itself among advanced nuclear weapons states by succeeding in the H-bomb test to safeguard peace and security on the Korean Peninsula.
					 Jimmy Kikoni, general secretary of the Workers' Party of DR Congo, said this in a statement on Jan. 8.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The technical development in the DPRK stunned the world again.
					
					 We are sure that the Korean people will make successes one after another, closely united around the leader.
					
					 It is our firm belief that Korea is sure to be reunified and emerge a prospering thriving nation as Marshal Kim Jong Un is standing at the helm of the Korean revolution.

articles.title: DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test Supported by Benin, Nigeria
articles.content:
DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test Supported by Benin, Nigeria
Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- Figures of Benin and Nigeria issued statements on January 6 and 8 respectively supporting the DPRK's successful H-bomb test to be specially recorded in history.
					 Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader", said:
					
					 The DPRK's H-bomb test is a measure to firmly defend the sovereignty of the country and the vital right of the nation and ensure peace in the Korean Peninsula and the security in the region.
					
					 We support the Korean people's efforts for defending the sovereignty of the country and ensuring peace and security in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Ibrahim Mantu, chairman of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria and chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association, fully supported the DPRK's above-said test as a legitimate right of the sovereign state and a just one which no one can find fault with.
					
					 The DPRK proudly joined the advanced nuclear weapons states by having access to H-bomb. This is a national event ensuring eternal future of the country in the present grim reality in which a weak country is subject to the imperialists' aggression and plunder.

articles.title: DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test Supported by African Regional Committee for Study of Juche Idea
articles.content:
DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test Supported by African Regional Committee for Study of Juche Idea
 Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- The African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea released a statement on January 7, hailing the DPRK's first successful H-bomb test.
					 The statement said that the African people following the Juche idea and aspiring after the friendship and solidarity with the Korean people extended congratulations to the Korean people upon their success in the first H-bomb test.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The DPRK conducted this test by its own efforts without adversely affecting its ecological environment.
					
					 This scientific and technological success is part of its measure for firmly defending the sovereignty of the nation.
					
					 The UN should make efforts to root out the very cause of economic blockade and aggressive military provocations against the DPRK that have persisted for more than half a century.
					
					 The UN Charter sets it as its principle to recognize and respect the right to self-determination of each country.
					
					 Then why is it going to stamp out the Juche idea of the DPRK and its social system?
					
					 It is the wisest solution for the U.S. to roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK and make a bold decision to conclude a peace treaty and develop cooperation with it.

articles.title: Representante de RPDC en Ginebra envia carta a director administrativo de FEM
articles.content:
Cuadros directivos de partido y Estado visitan alojamiento de delegados de UJS
Pyongyang, 14 de enero (ACNC) -- Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop y otros cuadros, funcionarios de los organismos del partido y las fuerzas armadas y el Consejo de Ministros visitaron el dia 14 el alojamiento de los delegados a los actos festivos por el 70o aniversario de la fundacion de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung. 
					Los visitantes felicitaron a los funcionarios de la UJS y jovenes que por la benevolencia del Mariscal Kim Jong Un tomaran parte en los actos festivos. 
					
					Estimularon a los delegados escuchando sobre los meritos realizados por los jovenes en la defensa de la patria y en todos los campos de la construccion de un Estado prospero. 
					
					Dijeron que en las creaciones monumentales y los notables exitos de la construccion de una potencia economica estan impregnados los meritos heroicos de los jovenes y les encomendaron seguir glorificando el espiritu de ataque de juventud y la cultura de la juventud de la era del Songun guardando en el corazon la confianza del partido que presenta a los jovenes como duenos de la potencia de la juventud.

Cientificos nucleares y otros visitan varios lugares de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 14 de enero (ACNC) -- Los cientificos nucleares, tecnicos, constructores militares, obreros y funcionarios, quienes hicieron aporte al pleno exito de la primera prueba de la bomba H de Corea del Juche, realizaron del 8 dia al 13 una visita a la ciudad de Pyongyang.
					En el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan, supremo lugar sagrado del Juche donde estan conservados los cuerpos del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, ellos les dieron el parte del gran exito en la primera prueba de la bomba H.
					
					Tuvo lugar con solemnidad bajo la presencia del Mariscal Kim Jong Un la condecoracion del partido y el Estado a los contribuyentes a la exitosa prueba de la primera bomba H.
					
					Durante su estancia en esta capital, ellos visitaron el lugar de interes historico-revolucionario de Phyongchon y el Palacio de Ciencias y Tecnicas.
					
					Recorrieron el Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Mangyongdae y pasaron un rato de descanso alegre en el Complejo de Piscinas de Recreacion de Munsu y el barco de servicio combinado Mujigae.
					
					Dieron agradecimiento al Mariscal quien preparo una magnifica recepcion y la mesa de alimentos por cumpleanos y les entrego los regalos. 
					
					El dia 13, ellos tomaron el camino de regreso.

Delegados de UJS rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 14 de enero (ACNC) -- Los delegados a los actos festivos por el 70o aniversario de la fundacion de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung visitaron el dia 14 el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan. 
					Ellos rindieron sublime homenaje a los grandes Lideres Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il ante sus estatuas de pie y en los salones de eternidad donde estan conservados sus cuerpos. 
					
					Luego, pasaron revista a las salas de conservacion de las ordenes y las otras de conservacion de carros, coche electrico, barco y vagones de tren usados por los grandes Lideres antecesores hasta el ultimo periodo de sus vidas para visitas de orientacion y viajes al extranjero.

Continuan mitines conjuntos de militares y civiles en ciudades y distritos 
Pyongyang, 14 de enero (ACNC) -- Continuan en las ciudades y distritos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea los mitines conjunto de militares y civiles para felicitar el exito de la primera prueba de la bomba de hidrogeno de la Corea del Juche. 
					　Participaron los funcionarios de los organismos locales del partido y el poder, entidades de masas, fabricas, empresas, granjas, universidades y otras unidades, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea, los trabajadores, jovenes y estudiantes de respectivas localidades. 
					
					　En los mitines efectuados en las ciudades de Munchon, Kaesong, Sinpho, Huichon, y los distritos de Paechon, Phyongwon, Popdong, etc. los oradores senalaron que gracias al exito de la prueba de bomba de hidrogeno, la patria se hizo potencia con el mas poderoso disuasivo nuclear. 
					
					　Afirmaron que el ejercito y pueblo coreanos daran mas acicate a la construccion de una potencia economica tomando mas firmemente las armas nucleares y frustrando despiadadamente el chantaje nuclear del imperialismo yanqui. 
					
					　Llamaron a todos a registrar grandes saltos e innovaciones en la produccion y construccion con la firme fe en la victoria y el optimismo bajo la orientacion del partido para hacer aporte a acoger el VII Congreso del PTC como conclave de triunfadores y de gloria.
